alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 27 at 1:47PM CDT until March 28 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT MONDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE WESTERN, CENTRAL, AND SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH 9 PM TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF THE TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM CDT Monday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from 10 AM Tuesday morning through 9 PM Tuesday evening. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam... Sherman...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Oldham...Potter... Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong...Donley and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Monday. Southwest to west winds Tuesday 25 to 35 mph with gusts around 60 mph * Relative Humidity...As low as 6 percent Monday and as low as 12 percent Tuesday. * Red Flag Threat Index...As high as 3 to 5 Monday and as high as 4 to 6 Tuesday. * Timing...Critical fire weather conditions are possible starting around Noon on Monday and then ending around 9 PM Monday evening. Critical fire weather conditions are possible starting around 10 AM Tuesday and ending around 9 PM Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
